modules.description: Checks if a given abstract value is in an optional octagon representation, converts between standard and optional octagon representations, and extracts the underlying value from an optional octagon. It operates on abstract values wrapped in a type that may include optional octagon data. This is used to handle precision trade-offs in static analysis by switching between precise and approximate representations.

Checks if an abstract value represents an optional octagon and converts between optional and non-optional octagon representations. Operates on abstract values wrapped in a type that may include an octagon structure. Used to handle missing or present octagonal constraints in static analysis.

Checks if an abstract value represents an Elina polyhedron and converts between different representations of polyhedral abstractions, enabling interoperability between loose, strict, and generic polyhedron types in static analysis workflows.

Checks if an abstract value represents an Elina polyhedron with varying strictness levels. Converts between Elina polyhedron representations and other abstract domains, preserving or relaxing constraints as needed. Enables interoperability between different precision settings in static analysis tools.

Provides operations for manipulating abstract domains in static analysis, including widening, narrowing, and intersection of constraints. Works with polyhedra and intervals represented as sets of linear inequalities. Used to refine program invariants during data flow analysis.

Handles conversion and inspection of abstract values between standard and optional octagon representations, enabling dynamic precision management in static analysis. It supports operations to check for the presence of octagonal constraints and extract or wrap values within optional structures. Users can switch between precise and approximate representations based on analysis needs. For example, it allows converting a non-optional octagon to an optional one when constraints are uncertain or incomplete.

Checks if an abstract value represents an Elina polyhedron and converts between loose, strict, and generic polyhedron types, as well as other abstract domains, maintaining or adjusting constraint precision. Main data types include polyhedra with varying strictness and abstract values from different domains. Operations include type checking, conversion, and constraint adjustment. Examples include transforming a loose polyhedron into a strict one for tighter analysis or integrating polyhedral data with interval domains for mixed-precision analysis.
